Name: Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome
Definition: A neuromuscular junction disease that is characterized by an abnormality of acetylcholine (ACh) release at the neuromuscular junction which results from an autoimmune attack against voltage-gated calcium channels (VGCC) on the presynaptic motor nerve terminal.

Name: obsolete Staphylococcus gastroenteritis
Definition: A staphylococcal infectious disease that is caused by ingestion of food containing enterotoxins

Name: obsolete Bacillus cereus gastroenteritis
Definition: A primary Bacillaceae infectious disease that is caused by ingestion of food contaminated with Bacillus cereus

Name: obsolete Sapovirus gastroenteritis
Definition: A viral infectious disease that results_in inflammation located_in stomach and located_in intestine

Name: congenital myasthenic syndrome
Definition: A neuromuscular junction disease that is characterized by weakness and easy fatiguability resulting from a genetic defect at the junction where the nerve stimulates muscle activity that result in muscle weakness and may affect nerve cells (presynaptic)

Name: obsolete commensal Desulfovibrionaceae infectious disease
Definition: A neuromuscular junction disease that is characterized by weakness and easy fatiguability resulting from a genetic defect at the junction where the nerve stimulates muscle activity that result in muscle weakness and may affect nerve cells (presynaptic)
